NODE 03A // ENTRY

A Repeatable Static Timing Review Routine

[2025.12.12]

A timing report is only useful when reviewed with the same structure every time. I use a short routine that keeps critical-path analysis readable for teammates.

Review sequence

  1. Confirm clock definitions and generated-clock relationships.
  2. Inspect top setup violations by endpoint group.
  3. Inspect top hold violations with emphasis on short data paths.
  4. Cross-check transition and fanout outliers before optimization.

Notes format

[path-id] u_core/u_decode/u_alu/...
type: setup
slack: -0.072 ns
root cause hypothesis: high fanout net + long local route
next action: buffer split + placement refinement

That format keeps optimization conversations concrete and avoids jumping to tool switches before understanding path-level physics.
